meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>fear</kanji> <kanji>dragon</kanji> is a <vocabulary>dinosaur</vocabulary>. Dinosaurs are much, much scarier than dragons, and that's why dinosaurs are called fear dragons in Japanese.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
